Message.Title: Eleven children escaped Newtown classroom while Adam Lanza was reloading
Message.Msg: Eleven children escaped Newtown classroom while Adam Lanza was reloading . "We learned, the way that no other parents should learn, that the most dangerous, dangerous part of an assault weapon is the magazine," Nicole Hockley, whose son Dylan, 6, was killed Dec. 14, said at a press conference with other parents at the Capitol Monday morning. "The horrible, brutal truth is that 154 bullets were fired in four minutes, killing our children, our daughters, our wives. The shooter carried 10, 30-round large-capacity magazines," Hockley said. "We have learned that in the time it took him to reload in one of the classrooms, 11 children were able to escape. We ask ourselves every day — every minute — if those magazines had held 10 rounds, forcing the shooter to reload at least six more times, would our children be alive today?"

Topic.Title: Eleven children escaped Newtown classroom while Adam Lanza was reloading

Message.Msg: I did a study on this. At the time it was reported that Lanza fire 140 rounds in about 5 minutes. The math is only a little different for 156 rounds in 4 minutes. My conclusion was that the difference between shooting & reloading 5, 30 round clips versus 14, 10 round clips would be about 21 seconds. Either it would have taken Lanza about 21 more seconds to commit the same crime with more clips, or maybe an additional 2 or 3 persons might have escaped. OR (if Lanza had been a little more clever) he could have shot each victim 2 or 3 times instead of 5 or 6 times and thus could have killed even more victims, even with lower capacity magazines. He killed 26 people shooting 156 shots, about 6 per victim. If he limited his shots to 3 per victim he might have killed 52 people with the same number of shots. The blabber about magazine sizes is uninformed.

Topic.Title: Eleven children escaped Newtown classroom while Adam Lanza was reloading

Message.Msg: The real problem here is that his nutty mother bought the guns for him, and she would have easily passed a background check. None of the proposed laws would have stopped her from buying the guns for her son. Thus the focus on background checks is not logically related to this crime. Further, out of the 12,000 gun deaths in the USA every year only perhaps 770 are committed with rifles of ANY type. Thus the focus on the AR-15 is not related to the over all gun-crime problem. Furthermore, Chicago, IL is earning a reputation as "Murder City." And they have some of the strictest gun laws in the country. Many of which the Mayor, Rahm Emanuel and his police force do not bother to enforce. What is the point of having more gun laws that no one enforces? The bottom line is that the Newtown killings are being played up as a crisis by liberal media so liberals can pass gun laws that they want to pass anyway, even though they are unrelated to the event.

Topic.Title: big report declaring the end of the era of gold

Message.Msg: Credit Suisse is out with a bombshell report .. titled: Gold: The Beginning Of The End Of An Era. The article argues that the 2011 peak of $1921 was the top, and that now the run of the cult metal is coming to an end. The argument essentially boils down to two arguments, which are related. The first is that we're seeing rate normalization. When real interest rates are ultra-low, gold does well historically. The second is that the era of crisis is over, and so the impulse to hedge against collapse (or massive volatility) is diminishing. Kendall and Deverell establish the argument over a series of charts.

Topic.Title: Eleven children escaped Newtown classroom while Adam Lanza was reloading

Message.Msg: It is undetermined weather anyone would have suffered more or less if they had been shot only 3 times instead of 6. On one hand a 22.3 caliber rifle is small caliber, maybe more shots would be needed to kill. One the other hand, it only takes one shot to kill a person, particularly a child. Years ago, my Dad was a hunter and prided himself in taking only one shot to kill a deer. He was using a 30 caliber rifle. A typical white tailed deer is larger than a child and about the same size as an adult woman (i.e. a teacher.: 110 pounds to 140 pounds.) I am sure Lanza's shooting victims 5, 6 or 7 times each was because of some combination of rage, excitement and inexperience.

Topic.Title: Eleven children escaped Newtown classroom while Adam Lanza was reloading

Message.Msg: Actually, a good point I hadn't considered is that while Lanza was shooting, everyone else would be pinned down. While he was reloading, everyone else could run. Thus the number who escaped during reloads might be a disproportionate burst and not a continuous flow. Also note that Lanza had 10, 30 round magazines and in theory could have fired 300 rounds. He "only" fired 156 rounds. A few more than half.

Topic.Title: O'Reilly Explodes At Laura Ingraham For Disagreeing With His ...

Message.Msg: N. Korea approves nuclear strike on United States By Jung Ha-Won (AFP) – 51 minutes ago SEOUL — North Korea dramatically escalated its warlike rhetoric on Thursday, warning that it had authorised plans for nuclear strikes on targets in the United States. "The moment of explosion is approaching fast," the North Korean military said, warning that war could break out "today or tomorrow". Pyongyang's latest pronouncement came as Washington scrambled to reinforce its Pacific missile defences, preparing to send ground-based interceptors to Guam and dispatching two Aegis class destroyers to the region. Tension was also high on the North's heavily fortified border with South Korea, after Kim Jong-Un's isolated regime barred South Koreans from entering a Seoul-funded joint industrial park on its side of the frontier. In a statement published by the state KCNA news agency, the Korean People's Army general staff warned Washington that US threats would be "smashed by... cutting-edge smaller, lighter and diversified nuclear strike means". "The merciless operation of our revolutionary armed forces in this regard has been finally examined and ratified," the statement said.

Topic.Title: Obama adds debt at 6x the rate of Reagan!

Message.Msg: That's total BS. The only rate that makes sense is the % increase by year. And this rate has not changed since Reagan: about 9% on average per year. More than that some years, less some others. If anything it was growing faster under Reagan. By this rate, the debt doubles every 8 years and will reach $32 Trillions in 2022 - unless the whole thing explodes before that.
